title: On the Advice Complexity of Online Matching on the Line
abstract:
We consider the weighted matching problem on the line with advice complexity.
We give a 1-competitive online algorithm with advice complexity $n-1,$ and show
that there is no 1-competitive online algorithm reading less than $n-1$ bits of
advice. Moreover, we present a weakly $c(n/k)$-competitive online algorithm
with advice complexity $O(k(\log N + \log n))$ where $n$ is the number of
servers, $N$ is the distance of the minimal and maximal servers, and $c(n)$ is
the complexity of the best online algorithm without advice.
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Data Structures and Algorithms
